title: England vs Bulgaria predicted line-up: Team news and more ahead of Euro 2020 qualifier at Wembley
text:
England meet Bulgaria at Wembley tonight.

The Three Lions have started their Euro 2020 qualification campaign in style and will want to keep up their 100% record over the next two games.

First up it's Bulgaria at Wembley on Saturday evening before a match against Kosovo in Southampton on Tuesday.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

It promises to be an entertaining affair as manager Gareth Southgate strives to keep evolving his side ahead of next summer's finals.

Here's everything you need to know

Shape Created with Sketch. International XI Show all 11 left Created with Sketch. right Created with Sketch. Shape Created with Sketch. International XI 1/11 Jan Oblak Slovenia Getty 2/11 Joshua Kimmich Germany Getty 3/11 Kalidou Koulibaly Senegal 4/11 Virgil van Dijk Netherlands 5/11 Andrew Robertson Scotland Action Images via Reuters 6/11 N'Golo Kante France PA 7/11 Kevin De Bruyne Belgium EPA 8/11 Luka Modric Croatia AFP/Getty 9/11 Moahamed Salah Egypt Liverpool FC via Getty Images 10/11 Lionel Messi Argentina Getty 11/11 Cristiano Ronaldo Portugal Getty Images 1/11 Jan Oblak Slovenia Getty 2/11 Joshua Kimmich Germany Getty 3/11 Kalidou Koulibaly Senegal 4/11 Virgil van Dijk Netherlands 5/11 Andrew Robertson Scotland Action Images via Reuters 6/11 N'Golo Kante France PA 7/11 Kevin De Bruyne Belgium EPA 8/11 Luka Modric Croatia AFP/Getty 9/11 Moahamed Salah Egypt Liverpool FC via Getty Images 10/11 Lionel Messi Argentina Getty 11/11 Cristiano Ronaldo Portugal Getty Images

What time is the match?

The game kicks off on Saturday at 5pm.

How can I watch it?

The match will be broadcast on ITV with coverage beginning at 4.30pm. Those without access to a TV can also stream it live via the ITV website.

What's the team news?

Tyrone Mings, Mason Mount and James Maddison could all win their first caps at Wembley after Southgate all three call-ups for this game and the next against Kosovo on Tuesday.

Aaron Wan-Bissaka won't play though after pulling out with a back injury while Manchester United teammate Jesse Lingard is a doubt after missing training on Friday with an illness.

Predicted line-up

Pickford, Trippier, Keane, Maguire, Rose, Henderson, Rice, Rashford, Barkley, Sterling, Kane

Odds

England 1/16

Draw 10/1

Bulgaria 33/1

Prediction

Southgate is set to keep faith in those who have helped this team turn the page over the last 18 months so the likes of Mings, Mount and Maddison may have to wait for their chance from the bench

That said, the usual suspects should have more than enough to get the win at Wembley against a Bulgarian side who is without a win in four qualifying games.

Expect Southgate to go attacking from the off and be rewarded with a comfortable win.

England 3-0 Bulgaria
